page.title: 04Farming
page.content: Most farms in and around Colerne own the usual farm animals, including cattle, sheep and horses. They use many modern machines on their farms but still possess some old equipment. They grow some of the most common cereal crops like barley, wheat and corn which are grown to help feed the animals. Other crops which they grow consist of swedes, clover and potatoes. One of the main problems in farming is the birds; some farmers use the method of cutting a piece of black plastic in the shape of a crow, and hanging it on a stick so that crows and rooks think it's a dead bird. A farmers day is long and tiring.It starts at 5.45am-6.00pm but is longer in hay making season. Nowadays a typical farm has three workers but fifty years ago there would thirty.
